thread.title: Traverse City sets all-time February temperature record
thread.title_full: Traverse City sets all-time February temperature record

author: Mark Torregrossa | mtorregr@mlive.com
title: Traverse City sets all-time February temperature record
text:
Traverse City sets all-time February temperature record Traverse City dogs playing.png Shaggy and Scooby play ball on the beach on the east arm of Grand Traverse Bay near Traverse City on Wednesday, February 22, 2017 (Norman Bowbeer) comments 
Traverse City had a very warm day yesterday, February 22, 2017. In fact, it had it's warmest February day on record. 
Traverse City warmed to 66 degrees Wednesday afternoon, topping the old record of 65 degrees back in 2000. Not only is 66 degrees a new high temperature record for February 22 in Traverse City, it is also the highest temperature ever recorded in February in Traverse City. Temperatures records go back to 1897 in Traverse City, according to the National Weather Service in Gaylord, MI. Numerous record high temperatures were set on February 22, 2017. National Weather Service - Gaylord, MI 
Earlier in the week, Manistique in the Upper Peninsula set its all-time February record high temperature at 61 degrees. 
While Traverse City was the only city in northern Lower Michigan to set an all-time February record yesterday, numerous cities set daily record highs. 
Gaylord, MI set a new daily record high and tied its all-time February high temperature at 58 degrees. 
Alpena set a daily record high, surging to 61 degrees. Sault Ste. Marie broke the old daily record of 44 degrees by warming to 47 degrees. 
The icebox of the Lower Peninsula, Pellston, hit 58 degrees yesterday. That broke the daily record by six degrees and missed the all-time February record there by three degrees. 
The high temperature of 66 degrees in Traverse City yesterday is the average high temperature on May 17. 
Two more warmer than normal days are on tap for northern Michigan, although temperatures will be nowhere near the warmth of yesterday. 
Then a big weather change comes in tonight through the weekend in northern Michigan. There is a winter weather advisory in effect for freezing rain and snow in parts of northern Michigan. 
If you have any pictures you want to show off of how you enjoyed a spring-like day in the middle of winter in northern Michigan, please post them below. Live Regional Radar
